extendedInfo.description: Klink is a utility by Faveset LLC for connecting a PC to your Android device over USB.- Supports Windows (XP/Vista/7/32-bit/64-bit), Mac OS X 10.5 (or later), and Ubuntu (32-bit/64-bit)- Does not require a rooted device********PLEASE READ:This is a free demonstration version of the paid version of Klink (Red Edition) that can be found in the market as "Klink (Red Edition)".- This demo only allows access to a select number of websites and is meant to test compatibility and speed before buying the paid version.- The paid version is completely unrestricted: secure sites and such are never crippled after time.- When testing Klink at home, DISABLE any other active network connections.  (Turn off WiFi or unplug ethernet.)  You can use one or the other, but both cannot be active at the same time.********USAGE:After installing and running Klink, please tap "Set up your Computer" and follow the instructions.  Klink requires the installation of a small companion program on your PC, so following the step-by-step guide is suggested.HELP: Please visit the Google Group via http://www.faveset.com/klink/support, or email klink@faveset.com.It would be appreciated if you asked for help before posting negative feedback, as virtually all problems can be resolved.  Otherwise, please leave your email address when commenting so that someone can get in touch with you.

reviews.comment: I\'ve never commented on an app regardless of good or bad feelings about one, but this one is just this side of amazing! It works great.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: Great app, kinda screwy how they call the pay to play version red more so you get to pay twice when you get a new phone
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Demo too limited
reviews.comment: I tried App and appeared to work fine; However, I could not verify actual web browsing speed due to demo being too limited. Furthermore, this App would be much better if it integrated SMS to PC like PdaNet does.
reviews.author: A Google User
